title: Widdop37
author: Widdop37
content: Will the DAG file on those new ETH forks be reset? Sorry if this sound like a stupid question but I want to if 4GB cards will be able to work on the new ETHW and the other, please enlighten me if I'm wrong.

comments.author: rdluffy
comments.body: It's not a stupid questionI tried to find some info, but nothing is 100% on ETHWThe new fork, in theory will keep exactly the same things from ETH right now, equals in the past but at the moment of the fork, chains will be different.Devs have the power to reduce DAG size, like ETC did in the past to avoid 51% attacks.If you want my opinion, they will not reduce DAG, if they reduce, we can see a huge number of old hardware mining again, and this is not the situation right now, with the end of ETH there's already tons of GPUs seeking for a new coin to mine.

comments.author: FP91G
comments.body: Quote from: Widdop37 on August 21, 2022, 09:08:41 AMWill the DAG file on those new ETH forks be reset? Sorry if this sound like a stupid question but I want to if 4GB cards will be able to work on the new ETHW and the other, please enlighten me if I'm wrong. The size of the DAG file will depend on the decision of the developers and the vote of the community, as it happens with the Conflux coinhttps://bitcointalk.org/index.php?topic=5410204.0It will probably be beneficial for the developer to have more video cards able to mine their forks, but it’s better to ask about it in the community of new coins.

comments.author: GEMIN_M4
comments.body: Nothing will be reset, this is not a brand new coin so do not expect anything of such, the journey will begin where Ethereum left off, the problem is how this project will survive, if all what ETHW have to offer is just the PoW algo its going to die.

comments.author: swogerino
comments.body: Quote from: GEMIN_M4 on August 21, 2022, 06:07:27 PMNothing will be reset, this is not a brand new coin so do not expect anything of such, the journey will begin where Ethereum left off, the problem is how this project will survive, if all what ETHW have to offer is just the PoW algo its going to die.I think that PoW is enough boost for the ETHW coin for developers to start building their apps like they did in Ethereum and this will keep ETHW in track to become why not the new coin which differently from ETH may be supported by the miners and apps thus making it the new number one coin to be mined,of course this is the most optimistic scenario of all,if they did reset the Dag file which I find it highly unlikely,a lot of this coin can be mined in the beginning and this would also be beneficial to many miners,again this is another optimistic scenario.

comments.author: adaseb
comments.body: The POW Ethereum that we mine today will stay with the current DAG. However if you want you can mine ETC right now which will work with your 4GB GPU. Unfortunately 3GB don’t work anymore on ETC since dag is exactly 3GB right now.Nothing resets, it just like a fork in the road. On the left you get POS and no miners and on the right you continue the old chain like nothing happened.

comments.author: OgNasty
comments.body: Is this an indication that people would mine a forked ETH instead of choosing a different coin to mine?  That makes me wonder who is going to support this forked ETHpow coin?  Have any exchanges said they would be supporting it?  Will nicehash still be mining it?  I'm sure nicehash controls a large part of the GPU mining infrastructure, so their support could play a large role in what the next big GPU coin will be.

comments.body: I am thinking many will switch to ETC.

comments.body: Nobody knows what the value of ETH POW will be. Currently on the futures it’s predicted to have a value of $40 per coin. Most likely ETH value won’t change by much. Unless there is some huge bug.The value of BTC didn’t change at first when it split to BCH but it did a few months after. Then BCH shortly hit a value of 0.10 BCHBTC so it was fairly valueable at one point. No idea what will happen to ETH POW because there I already ETC out there.
